text: Memphis World was an African American newspaper founded in Memphis Tennessee in 1931. It was edited by Lewis O. Swingler, and published by W. A. Scott and L. F. Scott. Educator and activist Estes Kefauver had a column in the paper. The World closed in 1973. The paper advocated for various civil rights causes. ==References== Category:Defunct newspapers published in Tennessee Category:Newspapers published in Memphis, Tennessee Category:1931 establishments in Tennessee Category:1973 disestablishments in Tennessee Category:Publications disestablished in 1973 Category:Publications established in 1931
title: Memphis World
